ovdesc.p: This is the historical version of DX. REP. POS. ACTIVITY file with the same lay out to make historical reporting possible

desc.p: Options contracts only - strike price, held in external format.
This field is populated from the DX.TRANSACTION record field STRIKE and holds the T24 strike price for the option.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
The field holds a list of user defined name of fields/parameter that define the uniqueness of the exotic position.
The contract that is being traded.
This will be a valid DX.CONTRACT.MASTER id.
Maturity period of the position.
This is linked to DX. TXN. ACTIVITY record that relates to this entry. This is populated only when REPORTING is set to YES
Internal strike price for OPTION type positions.
This field is populated from the DX.TRANSACTION record field INT.STRIKE and holds the T24 internal strike price for the option.
This is linked to the Order which caused an Order based event
This is the link to the constituent transaction which was caused by trade based event
Used for Exotic Options processing.
The field holds a list of user defined fields/parameter values that define the uniqueness of the exotic position.
The date on which the event has occurred
Taken from System date
The time at which the event occurred
Taken from System time
This is the link to the DX. ENTITLEMENT record which holds details of the effect of diary event on this position
This is linked to the constituent DX.TRANSACTION record for the relevant DX.ORDER, which was caused by the order based event
This is the exotic option type of the transaction & contract.
This is used as part of the key and is taken from the DX.TRANSACTION record.
This will exist as a valid record in the DX.OPTION.TYPE application.
INACTIVE - This field is here as a placeholder - if the DX.SOD.RPA.TIDY job is active, the contents of this field will be changed to 'YES' in the
corresponding DX.REP.POS.ACT.HIST record.
This is a unique key used to differentiate transaction events and prevent duplication of entries
The customer holding the position.
This will be a valid CUSTOMER id.
The date on which the event has occurred
Taken from System date
Used for Exotic Options processing.
The field holds a list of user defined fields/parameter that define the uniqueness of the exotic position.
This is the Portfolio ID of the Customer and is linked to the Customer Activity file DX.TXN.ACT.CUST
This is obtained from the field Trade. date from the relevant DX.TRADE or DX.ORDER record.
In case of Closeout, it displays the date on which the Closeout record is authorised
The T24 Portfolio holding the position.
This will be a valid SEC.ACC.MASTER id.
This is the date on which option premium becomes payable and is linked to the field PREM.VAL.DATE in DX.TRANSACTION
This is the link to the diary event that has affected this position
This is the link to the DX.TRANSACTION record generated at the end of exchange processing which calculated margin for this position
Used for Exotic Options processing.
As part of the list of user defined fields/parameter that define the uniqueness of the exotic position this defines which of these fields are part of the
position & price keys.
This is the link to the DX. TRADE which caused the trade based event
This is the link to the End of Exchange processing which calculated margin for this position
This provides a link to the last maintained copy of the position with value obtained from ID of relevant DX.REP.POS. LAST record
This key is complex. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
The key to this DX.REP.POS.ACT.HIST record.
This denotes the transactional event that has occurred
There should be a valid DX. EVENT. TYPE record for this event
This is the date on which the relevant DX. EVENT.TYPE is authorised
Used for options trades only - denotes whether this is a CALL or PUT option.
For closed out or partially closed out deals - key for the DX.CLOSEOUT record which has closed out lots against this side of the deal.
For closed out or partially closed out deals - key for the DX.TRANSACTION record which has closed out lots against this side of the deal.
